pageContext.claim: “And how about Papadopoulos? I didn't know Papadopoulos, but what they put him through -- he turned out to be totally -- they had a tape of his conversation that was supposed to be -- this conversation was like a perfect conversation.”
pageContext.analysis: George Papadopoulos, a low-level foreign policy aide to the Trump campaign, pleaded guilty to lying to the FBI about key details of his conversations with a London-based professor who had told him the Russians held “dirt,” in the form of thousands of emails, on Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton. Papadopoulos tried futilely for months to arrange a meeting between top campaign aides and Russian officials. In asking the court for leniency, Papadopoulos said he made “a terrible mistake, for which I have paid a terrible price, and am deeply ashamed,” and that he was motivated to lie to the FBI try to “create distance between the issue, myself, and the president.”
